wrath.common.scripts

Class Script

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrath.common.scripts.Script

  • public class Script
extends java.lang.Object
    The object that describes a script.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Script(ScriptManager mgr, java.io.File scriptFile)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void compile()
      Compiles code from the script file.
      void execute()
      Executes the Script's code.
      void execute(boolean dedicatedThread)
      Executes the Script's code.
      java.io.File getScriptFile()
      Gets the File the script is from.
      java.lang.String getScriptName()
      Gets the 'user-friendly' script name, which is simply retrieved with File.getName().
      boolean isCompiled()
      If true, the script is compiled and ready to be executed.
      void reloadScript()
      Deletes previously obtained objects and data and re-reads from the script file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Script

        protected Script(ScriptManager mgr,
                 java.io.File scriptFile)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        mgr - The ScriptManager associated with the Script.
        scriptFile - The File where the described script is located.

    • Method Detail

      • compile

        public void compile()
        Compiles code from the script file. This can only be done once. To re-read and re-compile the Script, use reloadScript()

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Executes the Script's code.

      • execute

        public void execute(boolean dedicatedThread)
        Executes the Script's code.
        Parameters:
        dedicatedThread - If true, a new Thread is made to execute the script.

      • getScriptFile

        public java.io.File getScriptFile()
        Gets the File the script is from.
        Returns:
        Returns the File the script is from.

      • getScriptName

        public java.lang.String getScriptName()
        Gets the 'user-friendly' script name, which is simply retrieved with File.getName().
        Returns:
        Returns the file name of the script.

      • isCompiled

        public boolean isCompiled()
        If true, the script is compiled and ready to be executed.
        Returns:
        If true, the script is compiled and ready to be executed.

      • reloadScript

        public void reloadScript()
        Deletes previously obtained objects and data and re-reads from the script file.
